mission: Empower men to reach men through intergenerational mental health support, reducing stigma and building community capacity for men's mental health
description: ArkBuilders partners with NAMI Franklin County and NAMI Allen County to deliver men-led mental health support programs through barbershop partnerships, intergenerational conversations, and community-based training.

key_programs.name: Barbershop Mental Health Partnerships
key_programs.description: Partner with 5-8 barbershops to facilitate men-to-men mental health conversations

key_programs.name: Train-the-Trainer Program
key_programs.description: Train elders, fathers, and young people in Ending the Silence and QPR (Question, Persuade, Refer)
key_programs.focus: Mental health stigma reduction in faith communities

key_programs.name: Intergenerational Community Conversations
key_programs.description: Facilitate conversations between elders, fathers, and youth to bridge generational gaps
outcomes: Elders understand their value and wisdom is needed
Faith community reduces mental health stigma

partnerships.relationship: Receives grant funds, distributes to partners, takes 10% administrative fee

partnerships.contact: Elisa Lisa Bradley, Interim Executive Director

key_insights: Men need to train and support men - women cannot effectively facilitate men's mental health groups
Intergenerational approach bridges wisdom of elders with needs of youth
Faith communities are critical entry points for mental health support
Barbershops serve as trusted community spaces for men's conversations
Pilot model designed for replication and sustainability

program_outcomes.for_elders: Understanding their value and wisdom is needed
program_outcomes.for_faith_community: Stigma reduction and understanding of mental health
program_outcomes.for_youth: Conversation, support, and feeling heard - 'If adults would listen, what would you tell them?'

sustainability_model: Pilot program designed for replication, foundation for larger funding requests, community ownership
source: Grant proposal meeting transcript with George, November 15, 2025
